Author: crxnamja
Title: The True cost of an iPhone and others...
Content: Being smart with your money is about fully understanding the financial choices you make and seeing the entire picture - the true cost and total cost of ownership when you commit to a device, transportation, pet, or even a child.\n

Author: SwellJoe
Content: I'm still trying to figure out how someone would end up with a Creed CD to have to get rid of it.  It just doesn't make sense.  Did Alexis or Steve pay money for it?  Was it thrown through their window by Diggers in retaliation for building a better social news site?  Was it left behind in the apartment they rented in SF?  Did Scott Stapp seduce Alexis and leave it on the nightstand in the morning?  So many unanswered questions.

Author: brlewis
Content:
OK, so these people found that when they switched from being vague and telling the truth to being specific and lying, that they got more useful feedback. Did they try to isolate the two factors?

I think saying "ourdoings.com does X" when it doesn't yet would not help my relationship with potential customers.

Author: aquafina
Content: captcha's can be necessary and definitely reduce spam, but some of them are so cryptic i can't even read them.\n

Author: drm237
Title: Startup Weekend In Hamburg 22nd/23rd September
Content: An idea for a Startup Weekend got huge amount of support in the German sphere in a short time and will happen in Hamburg on September 22nd / 23rd. The goal is to bootstrap a business idea in just one weekend. If this succeeds, the organizers would like to expand this to other German cities as well as other European places.

Author: brlewis
Content: Oh, I think I just understood this phenomenon.  In C/Java/etc. if you see more than two levels of nested parens you know at a glance that it's code that's hard to follow.  No wonder people's alarm bells go off when they see Lisp.  If they could just relax and learn it, they would find it isn't so hard.

Author: cperciva
Content:
"I trust you"

"If you get a subpoena for a passphrase for a client, you will give it up."

Not if I don't have it. This is the point of strong security -- you don't NEED to trust me, because I am not technically capable (nor, unless I'm quite mistaken, is the NSA) of decrypting data backed up using tarsnap.

Author: ivankirigin
Content:
Transparent human detection could be achieved with face-detection in a webcam with controls to ensure the stream is live.

Face detection is a solved problem, and accessing webcams from a browser is solved.\nhttp://www.merl.com/projects/FaceRecognition/\nhttp://youtube.com/my_videos_upload

If I weren't busy with another idea, I would suggest someone work on this. It could also be used for a secure login if done with face recognition, which is fast maturing.
